home.title: Palestinian Heritage Treasure
home.subtitle: Reviving memories.. Protecting identity
home.aboutProjectDesc: Our project is a national digital effort to document and preserve the rich Palestinian heritage from extinction. We work on collecting, classifying, and presenting our tangible and intangible heritage interactively.
home.itemsCount: So far, we have documented {{count}} heritage items
home.visionDesc: To be the most comprehensive digital platform for Palestinian heritage, contributing to identity preservation and bridging generations to pass this great legacy.
home.methodDesc: We rely on reliable sources, interviews with elders, and academic references. Each material undergoes thorough review before publication.
home.contributeDesc: Do you have heritage information or materials? We welcome your contribution to publish it.
home.heritageItemsDesc: Discover the most important cultural, artistic, and culinary aspects of our authentic Palestinian heritage.
home.whyHeritageDesc: Heritage is the identity and cultural soul of peoples. By preserving it, we connect the past with the present, and give future generations a window to understand their roots. Heritage includes not only buildings and clothes but stories, songs, traditions, and daily practices that distinguish our community.

home.proverbsDesc: Popular proverbs reflect the wisdom of ancestors and their accumulated life experiences. Here are some of them:
proverbsList: He who has no elder buys himself one
Those who feel shame have died
Out of sight, out of heart
If you leave it, it gets ruined
home.storiesDesc: Folk stories convey our values and morals, reflecting the struggles between good and evil in our environment. Read some stories lived in the Palestinian memory:

storiesList.title: The Story of Juha and the Donkey
storiesList.summary: It is said that Juha and his son decided to go to the market, so Juha rode the donkey and left his son walking, and people criticized them... Then they switched places, then both rode together, then both walked, and each time they heard criticism from people. The lesson: pleasing everyone is an unattainable goal.

storiesList.title: Zagloulah, the Village Girl
storiesList.summary: A brave Palestinian girl who protected her village from invaders with her cunning and intelligence, becoming a legend told through generations.

home.foodsDesc: Discover the most famous dishes prepared by grandmothers, with unforgettable flavors:

foodsList.name: Maqluba
foodsList.desc: A dish consisting of rice and fried vegetables (like cauliflower or eggplant) and meat, flipped in the serving dish to look like a 'cake' of rice.

foodsList.name: Musakhan
foodsList.desc: Taboon bread topped with onion cooked in olive oil and chicken, considered a symbol of Palestinian cuisine.

foodsList.name: Mafroum
foodsList.desc: Hand-rolled wheat balls cooked by steaming and served with vegetable or chicken broth.
